meanings.definition: (人や動物を)麻痺させる、感覚を失わせる
meanings.english_definition: to make (a person or animal) unable to feel sensation; to numb.

examples.sentence: El anestésico lo insensibilizó para la cirugía.
examples.translation: The anesthetic desensitized him for the surgery.
examples.english_translation: The anesthetic numbed him for the surgery.

examples.sentence: El frío extremo puede insensibilizar los dedos.
examples.translation: Extreme cold can numb your fingers.
examples.english_translation: Extreme cold can numb your fingers.

meanings.definition: (感情や反応を)鈍らせる、感じなくさせる、無感覚にする
meanings.english_definition: to make (someone) indifferent or unresponsive; to desensitize.

examples.sentence: La violencia constante en la televisión puede insensibilizar a los niños.
examples.translation: Constant violence on television can desensitize children.
examples.english_translation: Constant violence on television can desensitize children.

examples.sentence: La repetición de la tragedia lo insensibilizó al sufrimiento ajeno.
examples.translation: The repetition of the tragedy desensitized him to the suffering of others.
examples.english_translation: The repetition of the tragedy desensitized him to the suffering of others.

collocations: insensibilizar ante la injusticia (desensitize to injustice)

meanings.definition: (人が)無感覚になる、感じなくなる
meanings.english_definition: to become unable to feel sensation or emotion; to become numb or desensitized.

examples.sentence: Después de la noticia, se insensibilizó por completo.
examples.translation: After the news, he became completely numb.
examples.english_translation: After the news, he became completely numb.

examples.sentence: Con el tiempo, uno se insensibiliza a la rutina.
examples.translation: Over time, one becomes desensitized to the routine.
examples.english_translation: Over time, one becomes desensitized to the routine.

collocations: insensibilizarse al dolor (become numb to pain)
insensibilizarse ante la realidad (become desensitized to reality)

etymology.value: Derivado del latín 'insensibilis' (insensible), compuesto por el prefijo 'in-' (no) + 'sensibilis' (sensible, capaz de sentir).

usage_notes.explanation: 'Insensibilizar' se usa tanto en el sentido físico de perder la sensibilidad (por ejemplo, con anestesia o por el frío) como en el sentido emocional de volverse indiferente o menos afectado por algo. Es importante el contexto para determinar el significado preciso.

readability_explanation.text: This word means to make someone or something unable to feel, either physically or emotionally. It can refer to numbing someone with anesthesia or desensitizing someone to violence.

example_sentences.sentence: El dentista me insensibilizó la encía antes de empastar el diente.
example_sentences.translation: The dentist numbed my gum before filling the tooth.

example_sentences.sentence: Es fácil insensibilizarse ante la pobreza cuando se vive en la abundancia.
example_sentences.translation: It's easy to become desensitized to poverty when you live in abundance.

example_sentences.sentence: Después de tantos años en el frente, se insensibilizó al horror de la guerra.
example_sentences.translation: After so many years on the front lines, he became desensitized to the horror of war.
